ygData.subject: FW: [The EverQuest Tavern] Need some opinions n purchasing game
ygData.msgSnippet: I think you should be okay starting up again in EQ.  On the Saryrn server you will encounter some tweaking of alternates, but I found new players in the newbie
ygData.messageBody:
I think you should be okay starting up again in EQ. On the Saryrn server
you will encounter some tweaking of alternates, but I found new players in
the newbie zones all the time.

You will find helpful players running through and helping out at the oddest
times.

I have been out of the game for about 6 months, but working on justifying
the funds to get back into the game myself.

Should you choose to start playing again and wind up on the Saryrn server,
give a shout out to the Ring of Shadows guild members if you need help or
are looking for group members. They are a helpful guild and are not full of
high level characters too busy to take a night and help new players (even
old experienced players coming back into the game). They are not an uber
guild, but have been established on the server since it was brought up from
the Veeshan split.

I am rambling now, so I will stop and get back to work on justifying my
return....heh...heh...

Trej

Trejulor Satisdee 36th lvl DE SK
Trejulial Satisdee 39th lvl DE ENC
and others...

Saryrn server
-----Original Message-----
From: Yagermeister <odd_yager@...> [mailto:odd_yager@...]
Sent: Friday, January 10, 2003 4:44 PM
To: theeverquesttavern@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [The EverQuest Tavern] Need some opinions n purachsing game


Hey everyone,

I need some help on my next MPORPG purchase. I played EQ since Beta
and quit about 2 and half years ago (college took priority heh) and
now that I have secured a somewhat stable career, I'm planning to hit
online RPGing again. Question is, being that EQ has been out for 5
years, is it too late to come back and start anew? Meaning am I going
to look ridiculous (prolly will regardless) being the only lvl 6 guy
on the server in cloth and using fine steel? Realistically, I'm
assuming after all of these years a large percentage of the players
have either progressed to upper echelon in levels, or populated with
tweeked alternates. Should I be looking at another MPORPG like
Camelot (a bit more recent)? Suggestions are appreciated.

Regards,

Yager
